text: The Trans-European Motorways (abbreviated "TEM") are a project of the United Nations Economic Commission for Europe of sub-regional cooperation among Central, Eastern and South Eastern European countries regarding transport infrastructure. The TEM Project was established in 1977 Its main goal is to ease road transport in Europe, and to reduce differences between motorway networkshttps://www.unece.org/fileadmin/DAM/trans/main/tem/Road_Safety_Audit_and_Road_Safety_Inspection_on_the_TEM_Network.pdf. The TEM network contains more than 25,000 kilometers of roads. 65% of these roads have reached the full motorway standardhttps://www.unece.org/fileadmin/DAM/trans/main/tem/Road_Safety_Audit_and_Road_Safety_Inspection_on_the_TEM_Network.pdf. ==References== Category:Transport in Europe Category:Road transport in Europe Category:United Nations Economic Commission for Europe
title: Trans-European Motorways
